message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s history and symptoms suggest that he has epilepsy and is currently taking antiepileptic medication. Among the options, only phenytoin is associated with gingival hyperplasia, which explains the gingival tissue covering the upper third of the teeth and the bleeding gums.
